title: Blood Bank Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward questions related to blood bank Technology related etc. panels were given to rule out antibodies 2 cell rule out. Selected cell rule out. What antigens are affected by the enzyme and how they are affected enhanced, degraded or no change
Interview Questions: Panels Antigen related questions Type scree Grading results

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: Great company to work for and am very pleased. I love that they loved their employees. We are free and I love the quiet room on campus. Every time I went to work I felt like I belonged.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do?

title: Radiation Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Microsoft Team was used for a virtual interview. Friendly dialogue and the interview period was 30 minutes. Basic questions about the profession and clinical training. It was comfortable and insightful.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about the profession. Asked about my clinical training.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. Met with director of nursing , discussed the job, unit and my experience as a nurse. Also discussed scenarios and what I would do. Decent interview, accepted job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience as a nurse

title: MICP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 2 chiefs and a coordinator via Zoom. Asked experience based questions as well as those pertaining to clinical objectives and operations. Discussed system differences between multiple states and what can be expected from their clinicians.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our agency?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: Fairly Long process took a while to hear back after applying and after interviewing but was onboarded quickly after receiving the call from hr and accepting. Overall just have some patience
Interview Questions: Difference between a Project and a Program

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: My interview was cancelled 15 min before the scheduled time without a reason, horrible management and would not recommend anyone to apply for this hospital in case people face the same situation.
Interview Questions: My interview is cancelled 15 min before the scheduled time

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Hospital Newark
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. We had one interview where they mainly asked me about my work history and about my comfortability with the job tasks. Overall, a pretty good experience. Not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Meet with ANM for 15 minutes, preset questions, hear from HR within 5 days. Asks about prioritization, when u went above and beyond for a patient and how you would handle a staff member doing something they aren’t suppose to do.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It can be a bit intimidating with having 3-5 people in the room to ask you questions but they just want to make sure they’re hiring the right type of technician.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: i interviewed with the unit manager and clinical instructor. It was a very friendly and cal interview. they asked scenario questions and clinical questions. they asked questions about my background, questions about dealing with difficult staff. they told me what the job entailed and the shifts available.

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was called by a secretary and an interview was set up. I cam in and there was a manager with his colleague. Interviewed for about 40 min was asked if I had question. I had 5, and I feel they answered all of concerns
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position took about a month before I received a call for the interview. After the interview concluded I got a job offer about a week later. It was a fast process and once I was hired I chose orientation day.

title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Review of past experience and credentials.  Basic discussion of strengths and weaknessess.  Reviewed skills such as central line placement, arterial lines, and fiberoptic intubations  Discussed in detail the numerous amount of shift choices, always having a three day weekend and potential to do more overtime

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great. Went smoothly. Simple questions. She went through a list of 6-8 questions. Most are just generalized question  of how well you deal with issues at work and what you would do to resolve the issue. How you take ownership for problems and work to fixing it smoothly and efficiently. How you think outside the box and solve issues without running to manager for solutions.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with angry patient in past? do you work well in team? how do you deal with bad coworker? describe challenge working with diverse coworker?

title: Liaison for Hiv/Aids Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was pertaining to experience and challenges that was faced for the position.They asked how will I face difficult situations with staff members and with meeting daily goals of the company and department.
Interview Questions: What will I bring to the company, How will I accomplish my task with staff members if faced with difficult situations, with I meet the mission and vision of the company

title: Diet Control Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Hospital Newark (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: 2 person interview. Just an in person interview; no phone interview. Overall experience was that they really enjoyed my personality and goals and saw that as something wonderful for their department. This turned out to be inaccurate as they don't look for employees looking to move forward; only pawns for them to play with.
Interview Questions: Where I see myself in 10 years
